skillTree.localised_description: As creatures of flame and ash, the Red Bulls of Hashut cannot stray far from the Dark Lands, save for when the Winds of Magic – and Aqshy specifically – are at their strongest.

ui_effects.localised_text: Restores the hitpoints of units with the Hell-Forged attribute

enabled_if: Friendly War Machines or Artillery in range

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee.

skillTree.localised_description: Believed to be a rare mutation of the Great Taurus, the magical Lammasu are the living embodiment of the Dark Land's rage, exhaling sorcerous clouds to protect their riders.

ui_effects.localised_text: Restores the hitpoints of units with the Hell-Forged attribute

enabled_if: Friendly War Machines or Artillery in range

ui_effects.localised_text: Negates magical weapons within the effect area

skillTree.localised_description: Wreathed in smoke, these huge, winged Daemonic-bulls are blessed with flesh that burns with the intensity of a living furnace that sparks the ground 'neath their hooves.

ui_effects.localised_text: Restores the hitpoints of units with the Hell-Forged attribute

enabled_if: Friendly War Machines or Artillery in range

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee.

skillTree.localised_description: By which the foe slowly turns to stone, beginning with the feet, so they are all too aware of their terrible fate as it gradually unfolds.
A modicum of care is just common sense when getting it wrong can find you trapped in another, infinitely worse dimension…

effects.description: Cooldown: -10% for Lore of Death Magic

unit_ability.onscreen_name: Aspect of the Dread Knight Upgraded

effects.description: Cooldown: -10% for Lore of Death Magic

unit_ability.onscreen_name: Aspect of the Dread Knight Upgraded

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -10% for Lore of Death spells

skillTree.localised_description: The Father of Darkness protects his children from sorcery through a variety of magical means, all of them twisted and obscure.
Having a thing for hats can be most useful when everyone keeps aiming at your head…
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: When normally killed in action, this Hero will be wounded instead

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: There are always improvements that can be made to any process; this one ensures the Chaos Dwarfs' war machines and artillery are calibrated to perfection.

enabled_if: Friendly War Machines or Artillery in range

skillTree.localised_description: By which even those born of fire and flame, deep within the forge, can be healed.

ui_effects.localised_text: Restores the hitpoints of units with the Hell-Forged attribute

skillTree.localised_description: Tuned to perfection in the broiling-hot machine shops of Zharr-Naggrund, this machine will get its occupants into the thick of it and out again, no matter the lay of the land.

effects.description:
Attribute: Strider for War Machine units
	(own army)

Attribute: Vanguard Deployment for War Machine units
	(own army)

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: "The enemy's fear; their blood spilt in the mud – these are the things that sustain me."
Death is always just a shot away.
Professional soldiery means never running out of ammo at the crucial moment.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
What use armour, or even magical defences, against such powerful ordnance?
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Spellcasters can oft-sense when magic is close or being drawn from the Winds.

effects.description: Scouting action: Magic item drop chance is increased by an additional 5%
Scouting action: Magic item drop chance is increased by an additional 10%
Scouting action: Magic item drop chance is increased by an additional 15%

skillTree.localised_description: The locals take notice and will be inspired or frightened into action.

effects.description: Spread Corruption action: Chaos Undivided corruption is increased by an additional 1
Spread Corruption action: Chaos Undivided corruption is increased by an additional 2
Spread Corruption action: Chaos Undivided corruption is increased by an additional 3

skillTree.localised_description: Oft-times, though you may have much, what you want the most is what your rivals have; such envy focuses the mind and creativity.

effects.description: Steal Technology action: Research rate is increased by an additional 3%
Steal Technology action: Research rate is increased by an additional 6%
Steal Technology action: Research rate is increased by an additional 10%

skillTree.localised_description: Such a champion will not bend or break, but slay in their Lord's name.

effects.description: Wound action: Additional 5% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 12% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 21% chance of wounding target

skillTree.localised_description: The sight of a powerful figure extolling death and blasphemies can bring enemy ranks to their knees.

effects.description: Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -10%
Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -20%
Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -40%

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

ui_effects.localised_text: Restores the hitpoints of units with the Hell-Forged attribute

enabled_if: Friendly War Machines or Artillery in range

backgroundSkills.localised_description: With a Daemonsmith’s incantation, a mere drop of Hashut’s purest ichor is enough to reduce entire cities to cinders and ash.

effects.description: Unlocks Hero action: Blood of Hashut

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Whereas, among the Chaos Dwarfs, compulsive urges are normally frowned upon, seeing a Daemonsmith chase down Labourers himself certainly is a sight.
If you want something done, threaten to kill everyone else until they do it.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Chaos Dwarf Infantry
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "Overly-enthusiastic" describes this one well. He is blindly devoted to purging the weaker races of the Old World.

effects.description:
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +20%
	(accompanying Lord)

Increased experience gain: +10% for units when fighting against the Forces of Order
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Exceeding sensibility when spellcasting, this Sorcerer has no concerns about the dangers of petrification.

effects.description: Effect duration: +10% for Lores of Hashut, Death, Fire and Metal spells
Cooldown: -10% to Lore of Death spells

unit_ability.onscreen_name: Aspect of the Dread Knight Upgraded

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Maybe it's the hat, maybe it's just his nature, but one thing is certain: this one is a devious, slippery character, even for a Chaos Dwarf!

effects.description:
Enemy leadership: -4
	(enemy armies in local province)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This Daemonsmith is excessively proud of his own accomplishments, utterly convinced that he will soon rise to the very top of the ziggurat!
There are those who live for battle and risk death at every turn. Not so, this one, who is more than apprehensive when faced with the fray.
Whatever you've got is what this one wants, and the more enchanted, the better.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +30%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Kill them all and keep the loot for yourself. It's not a negative quality to be acquisitive as, after all, it's a material world, no?
Having spent a considerable period banished from their own lands, this one had the time to reflect and improve on their many shortcomings.
I'm not saying this one's heading for a fall, but… well, yes, actually I am saying that.
Me, me, me, mine, mine, mine – that just about somes up this one's attitude to, well, everything, really.
Stoic and calm, this one is never anything less than totally in control.
Backhanders – hell, fronthanders, even, so unscrupulous is he.
"Do we have to? Urgh, how tedious…"
